required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intervention Effect of TP and AOB-w on Acrylamide Exposure in Chinese Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Intervention Effect of Tea Polyphenols (TP) and Water-Soluble Antioxidant Of Bamboo Leaves (AOB-w) on Short- and Long-term Internal Exposure of Acrylamide in Chinese Adolescents

brief_summary.textblock: A double-blind randomized controlled trial (RCT) was conducted in current human study. This study aims to investigate the intervention effect of AOB-w on the short-term exposure and toxicokinetics of acrylamide, a dietary hazardous substance generated during heat processing, in Chinese adolescents.

detailed_description.textblock: In the morning of test day, participants were served with a meal of potato chips, corresponding to a single oral dose of 12.6 μg/kg b.w. exposure to acrylamide, and an edible capsule, which contains 350 mg AOB-w or the placebo with the same dose. Urine were collected within 48 hours thereafter. The diet was rigorously controlled within 24 hours prior to study till entire study finished. Four mercapturic acid metabolites have been investigated as urinary biomarkers for short-term internal exposure of acrylamide in human

primary_outcome.measure: Change of four urinary biomarkers of acrylamide
primary_outcome.description: Urine was collected prior to the potato chips meal and 48 hours thereafter, up to 10 urine samples for each participants. Urinary biomarkers of acrylamide were detected by UHPLC-MS/MS.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of two hemoglobin adducts of acrylamide
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected in 0, 3, 10days after the intake of potato chips meals. Two hemoglobin adducts (AAVal and GAVal) of acrylamide were detected by UHPLC-MS/MS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration versus time curve (AUC) Of acrylamide urinary biomarkers
secondary_outcome.description: Dynamic changes of biomarkers during the specified intervention period, following 10 urine samples in 48 hours thereafter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Acrylamide Urinary Biomarkers
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum concentration of urinary biomarkers during the specified period, measured by curve fitting tools of Matlab Software.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Peak Concentration (tmax) of Acrylamide Urinary Biomarkers
secondary_outcome.description: Time to Peak Concentration (tmax) of Acrylamide Urinary Biomarkers during the specified period, measured by curve fitting tools of Matlab Software.

arm_group.description: TP 0.05g, 0.1g, 0.2g (starches filled, up to 0.35g) capsule by mouth, Acrylamide (Potato Chips) 12.6μg/kg b.w. by mouth, for one single oral dose
AOB-w 0.35g capsule by mouth, Acrylamide (Potato Chips) 12.6μg/kg b.w. by mouth, for one single oral dose
Placebo (Starches) 0.35g capsule by mouth, Acrylamide (Potato Chips) 12.6μg/kg b.w. by mouth, for one single oral dose

intervention.description: Tea polyphenols 0.05g, 0.1g, 0.2g (starches filled up to 0.35g), edible capsule
Water-soluble antioxidant of bamboo leaves 0.35g, edible capsule
Potato Chips bought from market, corresponding to acrylamide (12.6μg/kg b.w. )

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject has no smoking or drinking hobby
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having any drugs within 7days
- Smoking or drinking
- Pregnant, trying to become pregnant or breast feeding
- Allergic frying foods
